section.section:
Bonds or notes may be issued only if:
the Director, or a person that the Secretary designates, determines that the issuance is necessary to achieve one or more purposes of the Administration; and
the Secretary approves the determination.
Without any other proceeding, action, or approval, the determination is effective when approved by the Secretary and is conclusive.

text.section: A bond or note issued under this section is a negotiable instrument under State law notwithstanding any other provision of the Code or any recital in the bond or note.

The manual or facsimile signature of an officer or employee of the Administration that appears on a bond, note, or coupon is valid even if the individual leaves office or employment before delivery of the bond, note, or coupon.

The Administration may:
issue its bonds or notes in coupon or registered form or both; and
provide for:
registration of coupon bonds or notes as to principal only or as to both principal and interest;
reconversion into coupon form of bonds or notes registered as to both principal and interest; and
interchange of coupon and registered bonds or notes.
A bond or note issued under this section is exempt from §§ 8-206, 8-208, and 8-213 through 8-221 of the State Finance and Procurement Article.

The Administration may issue a bond or note without:
the consent of another governmental unit of the State; or
a proceeding, or the occurrence of a condition, other than those that this section expressly requires.
The Secretary and any other person executing a bond or note under this section are not personally liable or accountable because the bond or note is issued.
